Class BumperCollision

  • java.lang.Object
    • BumperCollision

  • public class BumperCollision
extends java.lang.Object
    BumperCollision class sees if a ball hits a bumper and calculates the vector at which it should reflect off of
    Since:
    25-7-2007

      • collide

        public static void collide(Bumper bumper,
                           Ball ball)
        Sees if ball hits the bumper and if it does calculates the vector at which it reflects off of
        Parameters:
        bumper - specific bumper which the ball will collide with
        ball - specific ball which will collide with the bumper

        Find the impact point if a ball collides with a bumper
        Parameters:

        ball - specific ball which will collide with the bumper

        y - y-coordinate
        b - ball

                               double y1,

                               double y2)
        Calculates the distance between two points
        Parameters:

        y1 - y-coordinate of first point
        x2 - x-coordinate of second point
        y2 - y-coordinate of second point
